alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 01 at 7:37PM MST until February 02 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THURSDAY... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 65 MPH. For the High Wind Watch, southwest winds 30 to 40 MPH with gusts up to 65 MPH possible. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 8 AM MST Thursday. For the High Wind Watch, from Thursday afternoon through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Expect dangerous travel conditions due to icy roadways and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage. Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
